content: simple corner-out mitered square this pattern uses any weight yarn and any size needle because you control the size of the square by knitting until the sides reach the desired length rather than by gauge you will need a 20 inch circular needle or longer straight needles the square shape reveals itself when you bind it off these patterns provide a simple version and two decorative variations the square begins at the corner and builds outwards from the center cast on co 2 stitches knit k one row turn 2nd row - k1 make one with a backwards loop m1 place stitch marker pm m1 k1 3rd row k2 slip marker slm k2 4th row k2 m1 slm m1 k2 5th row k3 slm k3 6th row k3 m1 slm m1 k3 7th row k4 slm k4 8th row k4 m1 slm m1 k4 9th row k5 slm k5 ect continue in this manner until sides measure desired length bind off bobble on a wrong- side edge you can embellish the squares with color changes stripes or alternating stockinette and garter stitch for endless variations in your blanket they will always turn out beautifully square and just the size you wanted
